teaching_strategy: Show long duration with hand gesture
Emphasize the 'r' sound in American English
All these spellings make the same sound!
Glide from /a/ to /ɪ/ - jaw moves up
Glide from /a/ to /ʊ/ - lips round at end
Glide from /o/ to /ʊ/ - lips get rounder
The lazy sound - appears in unstressed syllables
Wide open mouth - front tongue position
Central vowel - tongue in neutral position
Rounded back vowel - lips form oval
Voiceless bilabial stop - puff of air
Voiceless alveolar stop - tongue tip up
Voiceless velar stop - back of tongue
Voiceless dental fricative - tongue between teeth
Voiced /θ/ - tongue between teeth with voice
